p: A few known bioactive flavonoids ( Figure 8) were abundant in the non-volatile extracts of the plant. Thus, the C-diglucoside flavone embinin ( 55) was isolated from flowers and leaves, the 6- C-glucoside flavone isovitexin ( 109) was isolated from flowers, the stilbenoid (−)- trans-resveratrol-3- O-β- d-glucopyranoside ( 110) was found in rhizomes, and the isoflavone (+)-tectorigenin ( 35) was isolated from bulbs [ 13]. In an MTT assay, embinin ( 55) showed a significant inhibitory activity that was higher than the well-known antitumor drug cisplatin, against MCF7, SkBr3, Ishikawa, BG-1, and A549 human tumor cells. Moreover, embinin showed a remarkable DPPH radical scavenging activity, that was comparable to that of the well-known antioxidant ascorbic acid [ 13].
